snippet: The Senate Armed Services Committee on Tuesday approved the nomination of former Senator Chuck Hagel as defense secretary, sending it to the full Senate.
abstract: Senate Armed Services Committee approves the nomination of former Senator Chuck Hagel as defense secretary on partisan vote of 14-to-11, sending it to the full Senate; vote is latest step in process that has deepened hostilities between Congressional Republicans and the Obama administration and has exposed stark disagreements over wartime foreign policy; some Republicans vow to use procedural tactics to slow the full Senate's consideration of Hagel.
lead_paragraph: The Senate Armed Services Committee on Tuesday approved the nomination of former Senator Chuck Hagel as defense secretary, sending it to the full Senate.

headline.main: Bitterly Divided Senate Panel Backs Hagel for Defense
headline.print_headline: A Bitter Divide As Senate Panel Endorses Hagel

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
